Patrick hopes to grow his retail shop to wholesale in the future.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy rice, maize flour and sugar.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is 37 years old, married, and blessed with six children.  He has been practicing dairy farming for eight years.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to improve his farm by buying a water pump.  He has also grown his profit and has educated his children.

Pius hopes to expand his business further in the future.  He has requested a loan of 65,000 Kenya shillings to buy animal feed.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en:
Maysoon, 39 years old, is a divorced lady. Maysoon is a very talented woman who has been making art from straw and wax, She even does embroidered clothes and covers.

Welcoming people with her beautiful smile has helped her in attracting more people to buy from her. It has been 10 years now since she started. In addition to her business, she participates in training centers to train the girls on embroidery and other skills.

Now Maysoon wants to expand her business by buying more materials and looking for markets for her products. For that reason, she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials and look for markets for her products

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат 53 года, замужем, воспитала пятерых детей.  Салтанат занимается откормом и перепродажей скота.  Начав 13 лет назад с покупки овец на сумму 5,000 сом (KGS), Салтанат смогла развить  хозяйство с ежемесячной прибылью около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Салтанат обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита Салтанат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, а в будущем – купить машину для семьи.
texts.en: Saltanat is 53 years old and married. She has raised five children. Saltanat fattens and resells livestock. Having started 13 years ago by buying sheep valued at 5,000 KGS, Saltanat has been able to expand her business, which now brings in a monthly revenue of 5,000 KGS from the sale of meat and dairy products. In order to further increase her livestock, Saltanat turned to "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS. Saltanat plans to invest the resulting revenues in continuing to increase her live stock, and in the future she plans to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 46 years old, married and has two children in school.  She has been operating a cafeteria to earn a living.  She runs her business with two employees.  She also does livestock farming for extra income.  She testifies that Faulu Kenya has been a blessing to her business because she has managed to grow her business with her previous loans.

Lydia hopes to open a big hotel in the future. She needs a loan of 55,000 Kenya shillings to buy beans, rice and maize flour for preparing food.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice and maize flour for preparing food

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Delia has a food shop that sells chicken & pork barbecues. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients used in making barbecue.

Delia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make barbeque

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.en:
Maria Vilma is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Maria Vilma has a rice field that produces rice grains she then sells during harvest time. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm.

Maria Vilma became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Maria Vilma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice field.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rosario has a rice field that produces rice she then sells during harvest time. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Rosario has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosario hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Melecia has a pigpen and she sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Melecia became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Melecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина замужем, имеет одну 6-ти летнюю дочь. Галина занимается фермерством –  у нее 3 большие теплицы, где она выращивает овощи. Галина занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет и он ей очень нравиться.  У Галины много своей земли и она с мужем хочет посадит там сад в будущем. В планах на следующий год – построить еще одну теплицу.

Галина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 8,000 гривен на установку системы отопления в теплицах. Это позволит ей сделать более раннюю посадку и продать овощи по более высокой цене. Полученную прибыль Галина вкладывает в обустройство своего жилья, а также в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Galina is married and has one 6 year-old daughter.  Galina is involved in farming and has three large greenhouses, where she grows vegetables.  She has been in this business for ten years already and likes it very much.  Galina has a lot of her own land, and she and her husband want to plant a garden there in the future.  They plan to build another greenhouse next year.  Galina is requesting a loan in the sum of 8,000 hryvnia to install a heating system in her greenhouses.  This would allow her to to begin planting earlier and sell vegetables at a higher price.  Galina invests her business profit into improving her home and to develop her business further.

loans.use: to install heating in her greenhouses

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a 19-year-old single lady, a freshman at Jarash University, majoring in literature.

Being one of a 7-member family has pushed her to the decision of finishing her studies so she can get a job to help in supporting the family. She has applied for a loan in order to register for the next semester and she plans to work hard at school.

Dalia wanted to be photographed with her father Mohammad who supports her in her studies and encourages her to achieve the best.

loans.use: To pay for semester fees.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is a 56-year-old housewife and a mother of five sons and daughters.

Her husband currently has no job because of his old age, but with the help of her eldest, the family is managing their lives. Now she has a smart daughter Heba who is studying to become an engineer in one of the finest universities in Jordan.

In order to let her daughter finish her studies and get a degree, Hiyam has applied for a loan to pay for the semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's semester fees.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга открыла новую точку и ей нужно закупить дополнительный товар - фрукты, овощи и цитросовые. Предыдущий кредит помог Ольге получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить быть семьи.

Ольга ведет свой бизнес вместе с мужем, Василием, который занимается закупкой и доставкой продукции на рынок, а также ведет финансовый учет. Обе торговые точки Ольги расположены в отличном месте (рядом, друг на против друга), поэтому у нее всегда много покупателей.
texts.en: Olga opened a new retail outlet and needs to purchase additional products - fruits, vegetables and citrus.  Previous loan helped Olga to make an additional profit and improve her family's welfare.  Olga runs this business with her husband, Vasiliy, who is involved in buying and delivering products to the market and also keeps track of financials.  Both of Olga's retail outlets are located in an excellent place (near and right across from each other), and this is why they always have many customers.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Eligio

texts.en:
Eligio is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married.

Eligio has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Eligio became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, Eligio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Teresa has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Teresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Teresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 72 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with nine children. 

Adelaida has a rice field and grows rice that she sells during harvest time. She has had this business for 25 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for the farm.

Adelaida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Adelaida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Paz has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Paz has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Paz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lisorio

texts.en:
Lisorio is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Lisorio has a pigpen and sells grown and matured pigs. He has had this business for 25 years. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Lisorio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lisorio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Paulita

Paulita is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. 

Paulita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Paulita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Paulita hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Nadiha

texts.en:
Nahida is a 47-year-old housewife. She is a mother of six sons and daughters. Her husband has a shop for selling fruits and vegetables.

Nahida is a person who loves to make hand-made crafts. She makes decoration pieces at home, as shown in the photo (fruit shaped decoration pieces), and she also has a small business selling home products. 

She is hoping that one day she can expand her business and have her own shop selling crafts and home products, especially center pieces. In order to achieve her dream, she has applied for a loan today to buy more products with which she can make more ceramic craft items.

loans.use: To buy materials for making ceramic crafts.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is separated with one child. 

Efren has a shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Efren has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Efren hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Evelinda

texts.en:
Evelinda is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Evelinda has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Evelinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evelinda hopes to improve her business.

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.name: Paciencia

texts.en:
Paciencia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Paciencia has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Paciencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Paciencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.en:
Emiliano is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Emiliano has a shop that sells herbal medicines and therapeutic products. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of herbal products to sell.

Emiliano has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emiliano hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jovy has a karaoke shop that provides karaoke services where the customers pay five pesos per song. She also sells soft-drinks and other beverages in her karaoke shop. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for the electricity and buy beverages to sell.

Jovy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jovy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity and buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Segundina has a food shop or "carenderia" that sells viands like chicken & pork "adobo", beef stew & fried fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell.

Segundina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Segundina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands to sell.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en:
Intisar, 38 years old, is a married woman with no children. She is an employee at one of the governmental entities. 

Beside her job, Intisar opened a small shop selling stationery items and cosmetics products. She has applied for a loan to increase the quantity of cosmetics at her shop and enhance the internal decoration.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of cosmetics at her shop and enhance the internal decoration.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Roberta has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Roberta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roberta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Epifaniahas a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Epifania has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Epifania hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Rushdi

texts.en:
Rushdi is a 36-year-old married man who has a tailoring shop.

It has been almost 18 years now since he has had the shop, and it is  running successfully. Mainly he tailors different models of suits. Now he has applied for a loan in order to buy more sewing machines and expand the shop space.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines and expand the shop space.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Eulalia has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Eulalia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eulalia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa, 36 years old, is a wife and mother of two. She works as a teacher and her husband used to work as a pharmacist, but now he is retired.

Using her husband’s experience, they started a small business manufacturing cosmetics and filling them into small containers for sale.

Now Sanaa has applied for a loan to buy basic materials for making cosmetic products to increase their productivity.

loans.use: to buy basic materials for making cosmetic products.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Nena has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Nena has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 55 years old and a hard-working mother of five. She works as a teacher, and because of that she insists on getting her sons and daughters a good education and turning them into productive members of society. 

Her youngest son Abdallah is now a college student who wants to get his Bachelor degree in computer information system and then continue to get a Master's degree, too.

To help her son finish his education at the first level, Amal has applied for a loan to pay for his semester fees. Because Amal is a conservative person, she asked her son Abdallah to appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with two children. 

Ailyn has a food shop or "sari-sari" store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ailyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ailyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Leonora has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Leonora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Luzviminda has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Luzviminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Luzviminda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Lilian Kamuche

texts.en:
Lilian Kamuche is a 35-year-old tailor in Mariakani. She is the single mother of two children. She has been sewing clothes for her customers for the past five years. She is doing great. 

This is Lilian’s second loan from KADET. She plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads and cloth materials. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan.
 
She hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads and cloth materials.

loans.name: Mary Boke

texts.en:
Mary Boke is a 39-year-old fruits and vegetables seller in Mombasa. She is married. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past four years with great success. 

This is Mary’s first loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more bananas, oranges, pineapples, mangoes, kale and tomatoes. 

She will use the anticipated profits to open another business and to repay her loan. She hopes to purchase a piece of land and build her own permanent house.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas, oranges, pineapples, mangoes, kale and tomatoes.

loans.name: Jackton Wanga

texts.en:
Jackton Wanga is a 26-year-old tailor in Mombasa. He is a married father of one child. He has been doing tailoring for the past four years and he is doing great. 

This is Jackton’s first loan from KADET. He plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread and cloth materials. 

He will use the anticipated profits to add more materials and repay his loan.
 
He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread and cloth materials.

loans.name: Nelly Amina

texts.en:
Nelly Amina is a 30-year-old business lady who sells fruits and vegetables in Mombasa. She is married and has been doing this business for the last one year with great success. 

This is Nelly’s first loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more coconuts, mangoes, kale and tomatoes to resell to her customers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. 

She hopes to have an expanded, well known business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts, mangoes, kale and tomatoes.

loans.name: Victoria Bahati

texts.en:
Victoria Bahati is a 35-year-old fruits and vegetables seller in Mombasa. She is the married mother of four. She has been selling fruits and vegetables to her customers for the past ten years with great success.

This is Victoria’s first loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more mangoes, bananas, pineapples, kale, cabbages and oranges. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. 

She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes, bananas, pineapples, kale, cabbages and oranges.

loans.name: Jukunay

texts.ru: Жукунай 56 лет, вдова, воспитала семерых детей. Жукунай начала свой бизнес в животноводстве еще 20 лет назад, стартовав с суммы 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Жукунай, ее хозяйство приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также, Жукунай обрабатывает 3,12 га земли, где выращивает картошку и ячмень. Летом, Жукунай с семьей выезжает на пастбища («жайлоо») горного озера Сон-Кол, где разбивает «юрту» - национальное войлочное жилище – где могут остановится туристы и приезжие гости. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса в животноводстве, Жукунай обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков и 10 овец. Доходы Жукунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Jukunay is 56 years old, a widow and raised seven children.  She started her business in animal husbandry 20 years ago with an initial sum of 3,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistent work, Jukunay's business yields about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  She also works on 3.12 hectares of land, where she grows potatoes and barley.  In the summer, Jukunay and her family travel to the pastures ("jailoo") of the mountain lake Son-Kol, where they set up a "yurt" - national felt house - where tourists and visiting guests can stop.  In order to further develop her animal husbandry business, Jukunay requested a loan in the sum of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase three bulls and ten sheep.  She plans to invest the profits into further increasing livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oranges, avocados, kale, tomatoes, pineapples, plums, bananas and mangoes.

loans.name: Josphat Mavu

texts.en:
Josphat Mavu is a 31-year-old tailor in Voi. He is married and has been sewing clothes for his customers for the last six years with great success.  

This is Josphat’s first loan from KADET. He plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads and cloth materials. 

He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land to build business premises.
 
He hopes to have a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing threads and cloth materials.

loans.name: Selinah Omenya

texts.en:
Selinah Omenya is a 45-year-old private school proprietor in Shanzu, Mombasa. She is married and she has been running this business for the past 13 years and she is doing great. 

This is Selinah’s third loan from KADET. She plans to construct more classes and buy new desks. 

She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and improve her school. She hopes to have the most well known school in the coast province.

loans.use: to construct more classes and buy new desks.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 45-year-old man. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a father of three children. He  completed secondary school only.

Mohammed`s business  is a grocery store that he started  five years ago with limited capital. It is the main source of income for feeding his family. Though he has been working hard, he can`t meet his customers' requirements due to limited capital as wholesalers require cash payment to provide him grocery supplies. So, Mohammed started to offer more services to customers such as bringing foods and soft drinks to their homes, etc which helped him to attract more clients.

Mohammed was happy about the attracting new clients but on the other hand, the financial challenge of meeting customers' demand is hindering his business progress and growth. So, he took a loan of 100,000 YER  in order to purchase grocery supplies that his shop needs.

In the future, Mohammed hopes to expand his business into a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies for his business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María es casada con el señor Agustín, tiene 2 hijos uno de 6 años y otro de 10 años  que se encuentran en edad escolar, la señora vive en alquiler mas de 5 años en el mismo lugar. La señora María se dedica a la venta de comida ambulando por lugares concurridos, ella vende todos los días de la semana tomándose así un día de descanso para estar con su familia. El préstamo es para invertir en otro negocio, comercio de arroz y venta de arroz, debidos a que ella asegura que puede tener un mejor ingreso ya que esto llevara a distintas provincias, siempre alternando con su primera actividad que es la venta de comida, la Sra. María es una persona muy amable y trabajadora se siente muy feliz por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: María is married to Agustín and they have two children, ages six and ten, who are in school.  For over five years they have lived in the same rental property.  María is a street vendor and sells food in busy areas.  She works six days a week and takes a day off to be with family.  The loan she is requesting is to invest in another business, rice trade and sales.  She claims she can earn a better income this way since it will mean traveling to other provinces, although she will alternate this activity with her main food business.  María is a very kind, hard-working person who is content with the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy bulk rice.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: La Señora Lucila se dedica a la venta de comida en la zona de El Tejar, en la casa de sus suegros, ella vive en la ciudad de El Alto donde diariamente baja a la ciudad a vender su comida para generar ingresos para la construcción de su domicilio, su sueño es ver terminada su casa tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 aún viven con ella y su esposo quien es empleado en un Supermercado de la Ciudad de La Paz, ella es muy trabajadora y esta muy contenta por acceder al préstamo ya que ayudara a mejorar su patio para estas épocas de lluvia. En la zona donde ella vende su comida es muy conocida ya que tiene muy buen sazón sus platillos, y por tal motivo tiene mucha clientela.
texts.en:
Lucila sells food in the El Tejar area, in her in-laws house. She lives in the city of El Alto and every day she goes down to the city to sell her food in order to earn income for the construction of her home. Her dream is to see her house finished.

She has five children, and two still live with her and her husband, who is employed in a city supermarket in La Paz. She is very hardworking and is very content to be given a loan that will help her improve her courtyard for the rainy season. 

In the area where she sells her food she is well known as she has very tasty food and this is why she has lots of clients.

loans.use: to invest in the courtyard repairs of her home

loans.name: Egnonnam Group

texts.fr: Le groupement EGNONNAM est formé de douze personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Claudine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Claudine est âgée de 50 ans, et est mariée à un certain Martin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Claudine a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Depuis cinq ans, Claudine vend des charbons de bois et de l’huile végétale à son domicile ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Claudine achète ses produits au Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Claudine et les autres membres du groupement EGNONNAM sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur fonds de roulement, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Egnonnam group is composed of twelve individuals all living in the same area in Benin and belonging to the same  "tontine" (a group savings fund). The group’s representative, by the name of Claudine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Claudine is 50 years old and married to a certain Martin. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Claudine stopped her schooling at the primary level. For the last five years, Claudine has been selling charcoal and vegetable oil out of her home, which allows her together with her husband to provide for different family needs. Claudine stocks up in Benin. This is the second time that Claudine and other members of the Egnonnam group are seeking a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to bolster their business and increase their working capital in order to meet customer demand better. The first loan has been duly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and jugs of vegetable oil

loans.name: Videkon Group

texts.fr: VIDEKON est un  groupement composé de treize personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupement sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupement du nom de Marie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marie est âgée de 47 ans et vit dans une ville du Bénin. Marie est une veuve ayant trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux ne sont plus à sa charge. Marie vit avec l’enfant qui lui reste à charge et assure seule ses différentes charges. Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Marie vend des ignames et de l’haricot à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de l’enfant à charge. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Marie et aux autres membres du groupement VIDEKON, de rehausser leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
VIDEKON is a group of thirteen people who all live in the same district in Benin. The group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the fourth time to bolster their activity and better meet customer demand. All three previous loans were correctly repaid.

The group’s representative is Mary, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Mary is 47 years old and lives in a city of Benin. She is a widow with three children, all in school, and two of them no longer in her care. She lives with her dependent child and handles the various household responsibilities on her own. She did not attend school. 

For the past ten years or so, Mary has been selling yams and beans from her home. The income earned through this activity allows her to support herself and her child. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

This loan will help Mary and the other members of the group VIDEKON to boost their activity, and increase their sales and revenue.

loans.use: to buy yams and beans for resale.

loans.name: Raison Group

texts.fr: RAISON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 23 ans. Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica est mariée à un certain Pascal. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica vend depuis quatre ans, divers produits cosmétiques par le système de distribution. Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe RAISON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The RAISON group is made up of three women who live in the same neighborhood.  The facilitator of the group, named Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 23 years old.  Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica  is married to a man named Pascal.  They have one child, who goes to school, and whom they financially support.  Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica  lives with her husband and child.  Husband and wife take care of the various  household expenses together.  Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica left school at the secondary level.  In order to support herself, Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica has been selling various cosmetic products through the distribution network for four years.  She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.  In order to satisfy her customers and to expand her business, Perpétue Judith Adjoua Cica (along with the other two members of the RAISON group) is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  This loan will allow them to better meet the needs of their customers and to generate more profits.  The two previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Akouavi Solange

texts.fr: Akouavi Solange est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Akouavi Solange n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Akouavi Solange est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Clément. Le couple a deux enfants scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Akouavi Solange vend depuis cinq ans, divers produits vivriers (soja, maïs) par le système de distribution. Akouavi Solange s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Akouavi Solange contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Akouavi Solange sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts reçus par Akouavi Solange ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Akouavi Solange is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. Akouavi Solange is married to a driver named Clément. The couple have two children, both of whom are in school and live in the care of their parents. The couple provide for the household together. To meet her needs and those of her children, Akouavi Solange has sold various basic food staples (soybean, maize) through the distribution system for five years. She gets her supplies in a region in Benin. Thanks to the income her activity generates, Akouavi Solange contributes to various family expenses. To satisfy her growing clientele, she is seeking a third loan with ALIDÉ. The two previous loans she received were both repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy bags of soybeans and maize.

loans.name: Volonte De Dieu Group

La représentante du groupe, Isabelle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans. Isabelle est mariée à un certain Athanase. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Isabelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Isabelle a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Isabelle vend depuis dix ans, divers produits (conserves, savons, riz) et des tissus. Isabelle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Isabelle sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe VOLONTE DE DIEU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: "Volonté de Dieu" is a group comprising three people, all of whom are friends who have known each other since childhood. The group leader, Isabelle (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 42 years old. Isabelle is married to a man named Athanase. The couple have five children, all of whom are in their care and attend school. Isabelle lives together with her husband and children. The couple provide for the household together. Isabelle ended her studies in primary school. To meet her various expenses, Isabelle has sold various items (canned goods, soap, rice) and fabric for ten years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and expanding her business, Isabelle is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDÉ, along with the other members of the Volonté de Dieu group. This loan will allow them to better respond to the demands of their customers and to earn higher profits. The three previous loans were all repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy various goods (canned items, soap, rice) and fabric.

Jocelyne Ernestine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Jocelyne Ernestine est mariée à un certain Bruno. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jocelyne Ernestine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Jocelyne Ernestine vend depuis cinq ans des mèches, des vernis et des vêtements de façon secondaire. Jocelyne Ernestine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Jocelyne Ernestine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DOGAN, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.

The couple have two children, both of whom are in their care and attend school. Jocelyne Ernestine lives together with her husband and children. The couple provide for the various household needs together. In order to pay for various family expenses, Jocelyne Ernestine has sold hair extensions, nail polish, and clothing on the side for five years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her sales volume and income, Jocelyne Ernestine is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDÉ along with the other Dogan group members. loans.name: Lonlongnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LONLONGNON est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Louise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Louise est âgée de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Louise n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Louise est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Calixte. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à sa charge. Louise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses deux enfants. Le couple se partage les diverses dépenses de la maison. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges, Louise vend depuis seize ans, des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son quartier. Louise s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Louise sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LONLONGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra surement à hausser le niveau de leur activité et à se faire plus de profits. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The "Longlongnon" group comprises three people who live in the same area. This is the fourth time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ, in order to raise the level of their business. The group representative, named Louise, is the woman whose hand is raised in the photo. Lousie is 31 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. Louise is married to a carpenter named Calixte. The couple have two children, both of whom are in their care and one of whom attends school. Louise lives together with her husband and two children. The couple share in paying for the various household expenses. In order to pay for various household costs, Louise has sold hair extensions and cosmetics in her area for 16 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and increasing her sales volume and income, Louise is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDÉ along with the other members of the Lonlongnon group. This loan will assuredly allow them to raise the level of their business and earn larger profits. The three previous loans were all repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: Honorine est âgée de 51 ans et vit au Bénin. Honorine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Honorine est une veuve et mère de deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Honorine vit seule avec ses deux enfants et assure seule les diverses charges de la maison. Pour répondre à ses divers besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Honorine vend depuis une dizaine d’année des tissus et des bijoux par le système de distribution. Honorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère cette activité, Honorine contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Honorine sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois crédits reçus antérieurement par Honorine ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Honorine is 51 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. Honorine is a widowed mother of two children, both of whom are in her care and one of whom attends school. Honorine lives alone with her two children and provides for the household by herself. To respond to her various needs and those of her children, Honorine has sold fabric and jewelry through the distribution system for about ten years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. Thanks to the income generated by this activity, Honorine contributes to the various household expenses. To satisfy the needs of her growing clientele, Honorine is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDÉ. The three previous loans she received were all repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and fabric.

loans.name: Pauline Pélagie

texts.fr: Pauline Pélagie est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Pauline Pélagie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pauline Pélagie ne vit plus avec son mari. Pauline Pélagie a un enfant scolarisé et à sa charge. En plus de son enfant, Pauline Pélagie a un autre enfant à charge. Pauline Pélagie vit seule avec ses deux enfants. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Pauline Pélagie vend depuis une dizaine d’années, divers produits (huile végétale, charbons de bois) et des produits vivriers (conserves, riz, maïs). Pauline Pélagie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Pauline Pélagie contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Pauline Pélagie sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts reçus par Pauline Pélagie ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Pauline Pélagie is 46 years old and lives in Benin.  She left school at the primary level.  Pauline Pélagie no longer lives with her husband.  She has one child, who goes to school, and whom she financially supports.  Pauline Pélagie also supports another child and lives alone with these two children.  She lives alone with the two children.  In order to support herself and provide for the children, Pauline Pélagie has been selling various goods and food products for about ten years (charcoal, vegetable oil, canned goods, rice, maize).  She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.  With the income that this activity brings her, Pauline Pélagie takes care to her family's various expenses.  In order to meet the needs of a growing number of customers, Pauline Pélagie  is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.  Her three previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: To buy sacks of maize, rice, boxes of canned goods and bottles of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Tévi Julienne

texts.fr: Tévi Julienne est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Tévi Julienne a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Tévi Julienne est mariée à un certain Pascal. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Tévi Julienne vend depuis dix ans, divers produits vivriers (sucre, etc..), des charbons de bois à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Tévi Julienne vend de la bouillie accompagnée des pâtés. Tévi Julienne s'approvisionne au Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Tévi Julienne contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Tévi Julienne sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement par Tévi Julienne ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Tévi Julienne is 41 years old and lives in Benin.  She left school at the secondary level and is married to a man named Pascal.  They have two children, who both attend school and whom they financially support.  The family lives together and both parents take care of the various household expenses.  In order to provide for her family, Tévi Julienne has been selling charcoal and various food products (sugar etc.) from her home for ten years.  Additionally, she also sells porridge and (corn flour) pate.  She buys her supplies in Benin.  With the income generated by her activity, Tévi Julienne contributes to the various expenses of the family.  In order to meet the needs of an increasingly large number of customers, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  Her two previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, charcoal, and sugar.

Akayi achète ses produits dans son quartier. En vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle, Akayi et les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts été bien remboursé.

At the same time as she practices this occupation, Akayi sells recharge cards for cell phones. This activity brings her non negligible profits and allows her to provide for various expenses. Akayi buys her products in her area. With an eye to strengthening their working capital and their activity and to better respond to the demands of their clients, Akayi and the other members of the group DIEU EST GRAND are asking for a third loan from Alidé. Their first two loans have been correctly repaid.

De façon secondaire ; Prisque vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques, des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Prisque s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Prisque sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MARIA KPEWU, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The "Maria Kpewu" group comprises four people who live in the same area. This is the third time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ, in order to raise the level of its business. The group representative, named Prisque, is the woman whose hand is raised in the photo. Prisque is 42 years old and lives in Benin. Prisque trained to be a hairstylist. She is married to a man named Marc. The couple have four children, all of whom are in their care and attend school. Prisque lives together with her husband and children. The couple provide for the household together. In order to pay for various family expenses, Prisque has run a hairstyling operation in her area for nine years, an activity that provides her with significant income. On the side, she also sells rechargeable phone cards, hair extensions, and cosmetics. Prisque gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her customers and increasing her sales volume and income, she is seeking a third loan with ALIDÉ along with the other members of the Maria Kpewu group. The two previous loans were repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy rechargeable phone cards, hair extensions, and cosmetics.

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUTIN1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la septième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Elisabeth est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Elisabeth est âgée de 58 ans et vit au Bénin. Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté. Elisabeth est une veuve et mère de quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à sa charge. Elisabeth vit seule avec ses deux enfants qui restent à sa charge et assure seule ses divers besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Afin d‘assurer ses diverses charges, Elisabeth vend depuis trois ans, divers produits et des charbons de bois à son domicile. Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Elisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUTIN1, un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. texts.en:
JESUTIN1 Group is made up of three women who are friends. For the seventh time, the members of this group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Elisabeth, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 58 years old and lives in Benin. She never attended school. She's a widow and the mother of four children, out of whom some attend school. She still has to support two of them.

Elisabeth lives alone with the two children who are in her care, and provides for herself and them on her own. In order to ensure that her various expenses are covered, she's been selling various products and charcoal at her home for three years. 

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's cities. Eager to meet customer demand, and in order to increase her revenue and income, Elisabeth, together with the other members of the group, is seeking her seventh loan from ALIDé. The first six loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy various food products and sacks of charcoal

Médégnonmi lives together with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses together. Médégnonmi never attended school. To provide for herself, she's been selling cosmetics and hair extensions at her home for seven years.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's cities. Eager to satisfy her customers, and in order to expand her business, Médégnonmi is seeking, together with the other members of the group, her fourth loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

The loan will be used to better meet customer demand and increase their profits. The first three loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair extensions

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et mènent leurs activités dans le même marché. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pierrette est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Pierrette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pierrette est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Gilbert. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pierrette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Pierrette vend depuis huit ans, des friperies dans un marché du Bénin. Pierrette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pierrette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
DIEU EST GRAND Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood and run their businesses at the same marketplace. This is the third time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Pierrette, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 38 years old, lives in Benin, and is married to a tailor named Gilbert. The couple has three school-attending children to support.

Pierrette lives together with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses together. Pierrette never attended school. In order to cover the various family expenses, she's been selling secondhand clothing in one of Benin's markets for eight years.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. Eager to satisfy her customers and to increase her revenue and income, Pierrette, together with the other members of the group is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: Gloria2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GLORIA2 est composé de trois personnes qui sont issues du même pays. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Akpamè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Akpamè est âgée de 26 ans et est une célibataire. Akpamè n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Akpamè vit seule et assure seule ses différents besoins. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Akpamè vend depuis trois ans des vêtements, des jus de bissape et de sucettes. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Akpamè s’approvisionne au TOGO. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Akpamè sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GLORIA2, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: GLORIA2 is a group made up of three women from the same country.  In order to increase its activity, the group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé for a second time.  The group's facilitator, named Akpamè, is raising her hand in the photo.  Akpamè is 26 years old and single.  She has not attended school.  She lives alone and takes care of her own needs.  In order to support herself, she has been selling clothes, bissap tea (made from hibiscus flowers) and popsicles for three years.  This business allows her to provide for herself without any major difficulty.  Akpamè buys her merchandise in Togo.  In order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income, Akpamè is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, along with the other two members of GLORIA2.  The groups's first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: To buy clothes, cartons of milk and sugar.

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies. La représentante du groupe Jeannette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 34 ans. Jeannette est mariée à un certain Didier. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jeannette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Jeannette a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire et a appris la coiffure. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Jeannette exerce la coiffure à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Jeannette vend des mèches et des produits de beauté. Jeannette s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Jeannette sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les cinq premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: AYIDOTE is a group composed of 3 friends. The group representative, Jeannette (the one raising her hand on the picture), is 34. She is married to a man named Didier. They care for their 3 children, who all attend school. Jeannette lives with her husband and her children. They both take care of the family financially. Jeannette quit school at the primary level and went on to learn hairdressing. To meet the financial needs of her family, Jeannette works as a hairdresser at home. In addition to that, Jeannette sells hair extensions and beauty products. She buys these items in a city in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her business, Jeannette, along with the other members of AYIDOTE, is applying for a sixth loan from ALIDÉ. Thanks to this loan, they will be able to better meet the needs of their customers and to make more profit. The first five loans have been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and beauty products.

loans.name: Philomène

texts.fr: Philomène est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Philomène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Philomène est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Victor. Le couple a sept enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs sept enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Philomène vend depuis une quinzaine d’années, divers produits et des condiments au Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Philomène contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Philomène sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Philomène is 38 and lives in Benin. She never went to school. She is married to Victor, a welder. They have 7 children, who all attend school and live with them. They both take care of the family financially. To meet the financial needs of her family, Philomène has been selling various products and condiments in Benin for about 15 years. Thanks to the profits generated by this activity, Philomène is able to help support her family. In order to meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base, she is applying for a fifth loan from ALIDÉ. The first four loans have been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy various condiments and drinks.

loans.name: Eliane

texts.fr: Eliane est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Eliane n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Eliane est mariée a un certain Roger. Le couple a quatre enfants tous et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Eliane vend depuis quatre ans des tissus et des produits vivriers à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Eliane vend des chaussures, des jus de bissape et des glaces. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Eliane contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Eliane sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les  trois crédits reçus antérieurement par Eliane ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Eliane is 38 and lives in Benin. She never went to school. She is married to a man named Roger. Together they provide for their 4 children, who all live with them. In order to contribute to family-related expenses, Eliane has been selling fabrics and food products at home for 4 years. In addition to this activity, she sells shoes, hibiscus juice, and ice cream. Thanks to the profits generated by this activity, Eliane is able to help support her family. In order to meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base, she is applying for a fourth loan from ALIDÉ. Eliane has successfully paid back all 3 previous loans.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Edwige

texts.fr: Edwige est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Edwige a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Edwige est mariée à un certain Geames. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Edwige vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Pour assurer les divers besoins, Edwige vend depuis cinq ans, des charbons de bois, des jus de bissape et des boissons à son domicile. Edwige s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et à Lomé. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Edwige contribue aux différentes charges de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Edwige sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Edwige is 36 and lives in Benin. She quit school at the primary level. She is married to a man named Geames. They both care for their 3 children, who all attend school. Edwige lives with her husband and her children. They both take care of the family financially. In order to contribute to family-related expenses, Edwige has been selling charcoal, drinks, and hibiscus juice at home for 5 years. She buys these items at a market in Benin and in Lomé. Thanks to the profits generated by this activity, Edwige is able to help support her family. In order to meet the ever-growing needs of her customers, she is applying for a loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Massavo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MASSAVO est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Philomène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Philomène est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Philomène est une veuve et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Philomène vit seule avec ses deux enfants. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges et ceux de ses deux enfants, Philomène vend depuis dix ans, des boules d’akassa (pâte faite à base de l'amidon du maïs) à son domicile. Philomène s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Philomène sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MASSAVO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra surement à hausser le niveau de leur activité et à se faire plus de profit. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: MASSAVO is a group composed of 3 people who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that this group requests a loan from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Philomène, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Philomène is 42 and lives in Benin. She is widow and a mother of 2. She takes care of her children, who both attend school. Philomène lives by herself with her two children. In order to meet the financial needs of her family, she has been selling akassa [a thick cornmeal porridge] at home for 10 years. Philomène buys the necessary ingredients in a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Philomène, along with the other members of MASSAVO, is applying for a second loan from ALIDÉ. This loan will help them enhance their business and make more profit. The first loan has been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn to be processed.

loans.name: Losambo Plus Group

texts.en:
Losambo Plus is a group of 28 owners of small businesses chaired by Antho. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE DRC to grow their businesses.

Antho is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She operates a general store. She became a microentrepreneur in 2001. She already received  two loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy items for resale in order to reinforce her working capital and increase the profit. She will seek to make more profit by stocking more goods preferred by her customers. 

Antho's business brings in a profit of US$ 480 per month. Antho is 51 years old, unmarried, and the mother of three children whose ages range between 16 and 23. One of them attends school. She is also taking care of her grandchild.

loans.use: to purchase items for resale in her store.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Exode Plus Group

texts.en:
Stephan is the leader of the Community Bank named “Exode Plus”, which consists of 29 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Stephan sells pairs of shoes, slippers, etc. for women at a market located mid-east of Kinshasa. He started his business in 2005. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. He has already received MFI HOPE DRC loans twice and fully repaid them. The loans he has received have helped him support his family. 

Stephan makes US$60 profit each week. With the next loan he intends to purchase more pairs of slippers needed by his customers and generate additional profits. His ambition is to someday open a shoe shop in his area. He is 49 years old, married and the father of five children whose ages vary between 4 and 13. All of them attend school.

loans.use: to buy more pairs of slippers to sell.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo
